name: Livin' Joy
description:
'''Livin' Joy''' were an international [[Eurodance]] group that formed in 1994. It primarily consisted of American vocalist Tameko Star and Italian producers Paolo and Gianni Visnadi. 

In 1994, the group debuted with [[Janice Robinson]] serving as the group's vocalist alongside the Visnadi brothers as producers. They released the single "[[Dreamer (Livin' Joy song)|Dreamer]]" that year, which became a number one hit on the [[UK singles chart|UK Singles Chart]] and US [[Billboard charts|''Billboard'']] [[Dance Club Songs]] chart. In 1996, Robinson departed from the group and was replaced by American singer Tameko Star, with whom Livin' Joy released the album [[Don't Stop Movin' (Livin' Joy album)|''Don't Stop Movin''']] Â (1996). The album spawned a string of hit singles including "[[Don't Stop Movin' (Livin' Joy song)|Don't Stop Movin']]", "[[Follow the Rules (song)|Follow the Rules]]", and "[[Where Can I Find Love]]".
